original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the triplets, the Paṭṭhāna text in brief

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.16. Piṭṭhiduka, Kusalattika🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nadassanena pahātabbo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo akusalo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nadassanena🔽pahātabbo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.

original: nadassanena pahātabbo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: A neutral state that is to be abandoned by seeing is related to an unwholesome state as a root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: dve, adhipatiyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: dve adhipatiyā dve pe a vigate dve
translated: As root-cause conditions, as object conditions, and as non-hindrance conditions, there are two.

original: Nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nabhāvanāya pahātabbo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbam na kusalam dhammam paccayā na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome state that is not to be abandoned by development is related to an unwholesome state as a condition being a root-cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: ekam pe avigate eka
translated: As root-cause conditions, there is one. As object conditions, as non-hindrance conditions, there is one.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nadassanena pahātabbahetuko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabba hetukam na kusalam dhammam paccayā na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome state that is related to an unwholesome state as a condition being a root-cause that is to be abandoned by seeing is related to a wholesome state that is to be abandoned by seeing as a condition being a root-cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: ekam pe avigate eka
translated: As root-cause conditions, there is one. As object conditions, as non-hindrance conditions, there is one.

original: Nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam na kusalam dhammam paccayā na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome state that is related to an unwholesome state as a condition being a root-cause that is to be abandoned by development is related to a wholesome state that is to be abandoned by development as a condition being a root-cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: ekam pe avigate eka
translated: As root-cause conditions, there is one. As object conditions, as non-hindrance conditions, there is one.

original: Nasavitakkaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā savitakko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa vitakkam na kusalam dhammam paccayā sa vitakkaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a thought that is not connected to equanimity as condition, a thought that is connected to equanimity arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasavicāraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā savicāro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sa vicāram na kusalam dhammam paccayā sa vicāraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With root cause as condition, there are three. … With an outlet as condition, there are three.🔽With a thought that is not connected to investigation as condition, a thought that is connected to investigation arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasappītikaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sappītiko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sappītikam na kusalam dhammam paccayā sappītikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With root cause as condition, there are three. … With an outlet as condition, there are three.🔽With a thought that is not accompanied by pleasure as condition, a thought that is accompanied by pleasure arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root cause as condition, there are three. … With an outlet as condition, there are three.

original: Napītisahagataṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā pītisahagato kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na pīti sahagatam na kusalam dhammam paccayā pīti sahagataḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a thought that is not accompanied by bliss as condition, a thought that is accompanied by bliss arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root cause as condition, there are three. … With an outlet as condition, there are three.

original: Nasukhasahagataṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sukhasahagato kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sukha sahagatam na kusalam dhammam paccayā sukha sahagataḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a thought that is not accompanied by happiness as condition, a thought that is accompanied by happiness arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root cause as condition, there are three. … With an outlet as condition, there are three.

original: Naupekkhāsahagataṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā upekkhāsahagato kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na aupekkhā sahagatam na kusalam dhammam paccayā upekkhā sahagataḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the unprofitable as condition, the profitable. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nanakāmāvacaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nakāmāvacaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na na kāmāvacaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā na kāmāvacaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the unprofitable as condition, the neither-profitable-nor- unprofitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the profitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the unprofitable. (In brief.)

original: Nanakāmāvacaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kāmāvacaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na na kāmāvacaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā kāmāvacaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the profitable. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Narūpāvacaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā rūpāvacaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na rūpāvacaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā rūpāvacaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the unprofitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the profitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable. (In brief.)

original: Narūpāvacaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā narūpāvacaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na rūpāvacaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā na rūpāvacaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the profitable. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Naarūpāvacaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā arūpāvacaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve 🔽na arūpāvacaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā arūpāvacaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the unprofitable. (In brief.)🔽With the neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable as condition, the

original: Naarūpāvacaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naarūpāvacaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na arūpāvacaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā na arūpāvacaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-form-sphere profitable state as condition, a non-form-sphere profitable consciousness arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Naapariyāpannaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā apariyāpanno kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na apariyāpannam na kusalam dhammam paccayā apariyāpannaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: In the root-cause condition, there are two … in the unprompted condition, there are two.🔽With a non-included profitable state as condition, a non-included profitable consciousness arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Naapariyāpannaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā pariyāpanno kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na apariyāpannam na kusalam dhammam paccayā pariyāpannaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-included profitable state as condition, an included profitable consciousness arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Naniyyānikaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā niyyāniko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na niyyānikam na kusalam dhammam paccayā niyyānikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: In the root-cause condition, there are two … in the unprompted condition, there are two.🔽With a non-leading-out profitable state as condition, a leading-out profitable consciousness arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Naniyyānikaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naaniyyāniko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na niyyānikam na kusalam dhammam paccayā na aniyyānikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-leading-out profitable state as condition, a non-leading-out profitable consciousness arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: In the root-cause condition, there are two … in the unprompted condition, there are two.

original: Naniyataṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā niyato kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naniyataṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā aniyato kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na niyatam na kusalam dhammam paccayā niyataḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na niyatam na kusalam dhammam paccayā aniyataḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: From a definite unwholesome state as condition, an indefinite wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition. From a definite unwholesome state as condition, an indefinite wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Naanuttaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anuttaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na anuttaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā anuttaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: From a root-cause, two … (and so on as in § 10) … from an unobscured-indeterminate state as condition, two …🔽From a non-supreme unwholesome state as condition, a supreme wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Naanuttaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sauttaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na anuttaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā sauttaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: From a non-supreme unwholesome state as condition, a supreme wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā araṇo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na saraṇam na kusalam dhammam paccayā araṇaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: From a root-cause, two … (and so on as in § 10) … from an unobscured-indeterminate state as condition, two …🔽From a non-conflict unwholesome state as condition, a conflict wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) From a root-cause, one … (and so on as in § 10) … from an unobscured-indeterminate state as condition, one …

original: Nasaraṇaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā saraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na saraṇam na akusalam dhammam paccayā saraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: From a non-conflict unwholesome state as condition, a conflict unwholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) From a root-cause, one … (and so on as in § 10) … from an unobscured-indeterminate state as condition, one …

original: Nasaraṇaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naaraṇaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na saraṇam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na araṇam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a non-conflict condition that is neutral, a non-conflict neutral thought arises, by way of root-cause condition.🔽Dependent on a non-conflict condition that is neutral, a non-conflict neutral thought arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve, adhipatiyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: dve adhipatiyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: (In brief.) In two ways by way of root-cause condition, in two ways by way of predominance condition … in two ways by way of non-hindrance condition.
